definition: slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
slight or important, urgent or non-urgent (idiom); to deal with important matters first/sense of priority
slight or important, urgent or non-urgent (idiom); to deal with important matters first/sense of priority/also written 輕重緩急|轻重缓急
to help one another in difficulty/mutual assistance in extremity

sentences.english: Serve the citizens in order of priority and urgency on practical affair, take the easiest the first .
sentences.chinese: 我們爲市民辦實事要分輕重緩急，先易後難。

sentences.english: Tan pointed out that the government had established priorities.
sentences.chinese: 譚富卞指出政府已定下了輕重緩急。

sentences.english: Understand the urgency of the situation.
The Froude number of flow is the factor of flow status: supercritical flow or subcritical flow.
sentences.chinese: 由流體流動的福勞德數可以確定流動的緩急程度。

sentences.english: This person should be able to easily answer the questions on setting priorities.
sentences.chinese: 應聘人應該能輕鬆的回答有關決定輕重緩急的問題。

sentences.english: It was a matter of balancing priorities.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個權衡輕重緩急的問題。

sentences.english: Learnd to set priorities and make decisions.
sentences.chinese: 學會分清輕重緩急和做決定。

definition: my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
name and reality/how sth is portrayed and what it is actually like
one's four limbs/two arms and two legs
location on wrist over the radial artery where pulse is taken in TCM
slight or important, urgent or non-urgent (idiom); to deal with important matters first/sense of priority
